characters.alibi: Claims to have been at home working on his dissertation.
characters.description: A brooding and intense doctoral candidate with a penchant for late-night study sessions and a complicated relationship with Professor Eldridge.
characters.name: David Chen
characters.personality: Quiet and intelligent, but can be secretive and evasive when questioned about his relationship with the victim.

characters.alibi: Claims to have been at the university library all evening.
characters.description: A sharp-tongued and ambitious faculty member who had several public disagreements with Professor Eldridge regarding research funding and academic credit. Known for her meticulous research and competitive nature.
characters.name: Dr. Amara Khan
characters.personality: Assertive, driven, and doesn't shy away from confrontation. Presents a cool and detached demeanor.

characters.alibi: Claims to have been at home sick, but cannot provide verification.
characters.description: The university's eccentric and tenured professor of theoretical physics, known for his unconventional teaching methods and rumored to have a gambling problem. Has been with the university for 30 years.
characters.name: Professor Mark Jenkins
characters.personality: Flamboyant and unpredictable, often making cryptic remarks that are difficult to interpret. Seems genuinely upset by the professor's death.

characters.alibi: Confirmed by security footage; Left the lab at 6:00 PM.
characters.description: A meticulous and dedicated lab technician who worked closely with Professor Eldridge. Responsible for maintaining the lab equipment and assisting with experiments. A timid and reliable employee.
characters.name: Sarah Miller
characters.personality: Nervous and soft-spoken, eager to please authority figures. Appears genuinely shocked and saddened by the Professor's death.

characters.alibi: Claims to have had dinner at a restaurant with their spouse
characters.description: A renowned professor of chemistry, admired and envied for his groundbreaking research in nanotechnology. He was found dead in his lab late at night.
characters.name: Professor Alastair Eldridge
characters.personality: Charismatic and brilliant, but also known to be demanding and uncompromising. Highly respected in his field.

characters.alibi: Valid employee records and security badge swipes confirm that the the security guard patrolled the north end of the campus during the entire period in question.
characters.description: A dutiful and observant security guard who was on duty the night of the murder. Routinely patrols the science building and is familiar with the staff and their schedules.
characters.name: Officer David Ramirez
characters.personality: Serious and professional, takes his job very seriously. Eager to assist with the investigation.

characters.alibi: Claims to hace been at the local pub with friends.
characters.description: A recent graduate student and former advisee of Professor Eldridge, now working as a research assistant. Recently moved to a new apartment.
characters.name: Emily Carter
characters.personality: Excitable and friendly, seems genuinely upset about Eldridge's death, but shows signs of holding back information.

characters.alibi: Claims to have been at the movies with family. Has ticket stubs.
characters.description: Professor Eldridge's wife, an art curator at a local museum. Described as sophisticated and reserved. She seems to be holding back information.
characters.name: Olivia Eldridge
characters.personality: Stoic and composed, maintains a dignified demeanor despite the tragic circumstances. Holds a deep understanding of art and the art world.

clues.description: A half-empty vial labeled 'Experimental Compound X-77'. Has a faint almond smell.
clues.name: Broken Vial

clues.description: David Chen's doctoral dissertation proposal, heavily edited with scathing remarks by Professor Eldridge.
clues.name: Dissertation Proposal

clues.description: A lab coat found in David Chen's locker with traces of Compound X-77.
clues.name: Lab Coat

clues.description: Security footage shows David Chen and Professor Eldridge arguing heatedly outside the lab on the day of the murder.
clues.name: Argument Footage

clues.description: An email from Professor Eldridge to David Chen stating that he will not endorse his dissertation.
clues.name: Email

clues.description: Credit card statements with large gambling debts.
clues.name: Financial Records

clues.description: A receipt from the university library, time-stamped during the period when the murder took place.
clues.name: Library Receipt

clues.description: Log indicating Dr. Khan's swipe card was used to access the lab multiple times on the night of the murder.
clues.name: Lab Access Logs

clues.description: A funding proposal authored by Dr. Khan that was rejected by Professor Eldridge in favor of another researcher's project.
clues.name: Funding Proposal

clues.description: Professor Eldridge's notebook containing notes on Dr. Khan's research, with several critical annotations.
clues.name: Professor's Notebook

clues.description: Security footage shows Dr. Khan entering and exiting the science building around the time of the murder.
clues.name: Security Footage

clues.description: A note from his doctor excusing him from teaching due to illness.
clues.name: Sick Note

clues.description: A casino chip from a high-stakes poker game found in Professor Jenkins' office.
clues.name: Casino Chip

clues.description: Scrawled notes referencing Professor Eldridge's research within Professor Jenkins' handwriting.
clues.name: Professor Jenkins' Notes

clues.description: Lab schedule shows Professor Eldridge was scheduled to work late the night of the murder.
clues.name: Lab Schedule

clues.description: Calendar in Eldridge's office shows a cryptic note indicating a meeting.
clues.name: Eldridge's Calendar

clues.description: Evidence found in the victims lab coat and apartment that shows residue from a new apartment.
clues.name: Residue

clues.description: The last will and testament of Professor Eldridge, detailing a major update to it the day before he died.
clues.name: Last Will and Testament

clues.description: Credit card statements show numerous, expensive purchases of artwork.
clues.name: Credit Card Statement

clues.description: Movie Tickets to a movie.
clues.name: Movie Tickets

locations.description: A state-of-the-art research facility filled with advanced equipment and scientific instruments. The air is thick with the smell of chemicals.
locations.name: Science Building Lab

locations.description: A quiet and expansive space filled with books and study carrels. The atmosphere is hushed and academic.
locations.name: University Library

locations.description: A series of offices occupied by faculty members. Each office reflects the personality and research interests of its occupant.
locations.name: Faculty Offices

locations.description: A cluttered and untidy home filled trinkets and objects from around the world. The house has signs that it is not maintained well.
locations.name: Jenkins' House

locations.description: A prestigious museum, dedicated to the fine arts and history
locations.name: Art Museum

mystery.description: Professor Alastair Eldridge, a brilliant chemist, was found dead in his lab late at night. The scene suggests foul play, with a broken vial of a dangerous experimental compound nearby.
mystery.shortDescription: A renowned chemistry professor is found dead in his lab, surrounded by dangerous experimental compounds.
mystery.title: The Chemistry of Deceit

solution.method: Dr. Khan, driven by professional jealousy and the fear of being overshadowed, poisoned Professor Eldridge with Compound X-77. She accessed the lab using her key card and administered the poison.
solution.motive: Dr. Khan was envious of Professor Eldridge's success and bitter about his rejection of her funding proposal. She feared her career would stagnate under his shadow.
